title: Exporting sets in Linotype font explorer
content:
I have finally finished categorizing my fonts into sets in Linotype Font Explorer (serif, sans serif, modular, chunky, decorative, script, etc), but is there any way I can export these sets for the benefit my colleagues too?

Thanks

Dave
author: WhitePepper

comments.content:
Hi, i was waiting for some answer because I am curios about export from Font Explorer too. There is only one Export function in top menu. Choose Font \> Export and then decide what do you want to export: fonts, images of fonts or only information about fonts in your set. Is it helpful?

Premysl

If you want to catalog and manage sets of fonts, have a look at Fontbase.  
 [http://www.dtptypes.com/software/fontbase.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100826074923/http:/www.dtptypes.com/software/fontbase.html "http://www.dtptypes.com/software/fontbase.html")

Premysl - the export function (I think) allows you to collect the original font files together to take to another computer (in the same way you would collect fonts for output in a Quark document), rather than exporting the sets themselves.

Malcolm - fontbase looks like the sort of thing I'm after. Do you use it?

Dave

Also, I've just had a thought. we all have fontbook on our macs - is this something i could use to categorize fonts and then export this categorization?

Dave
